atan2.model
Class ControllerAdaptor

java.lang.Object
  atan2.model.ControllerAdaptor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Controller
public class ControllerAdaptor
extends java.lang.Object
implements Controller

Adaptor class for easier use of the controller interface.

Constructor Detail

ControllerAdaptor

public ControllerAdaptor()
Standard constructor. Sets the goalie state to false.
Beware that the player which is to be controlled by this controller must be set later on by using the setPlayer()-Method.

ControllerAdaptor

public ControllerAdaptor(boolean isGoalie)
Extended constructor.
Beware that the player which is to be controlled by this controller must be set later on by using the setPlayer()-Method.

Parameters:
isGoalie - Flag indicating whether controlled player has goalie state or not.

ControllerAdaptor

public ControllerAdaptor(boolean isGoalie,
                         Player player)
Full constructor.

Parameters:
isGoalie - Flag indicating whether controlled player has goalie state or not.
player - Player to be controlled by this controller.
Method Detail

isGoalie

public final boolean isGoalie()
Description copied from interface: Controller
Checks whether the controlled player has goalie state.

Specified by:
isGoalie in interface Controller
Returns:
True if controlled player is a goalie, false otherwise.

setPlayer

public final void setPlayer(Player p)
Description copied from interface: Controller
Sets the player to be controlled by this controller.

setPlayer in interface Controller
Parameters:
p - Player to be controlled.

preInfo

public void preInfo()
Description copied from interface: Controller
Called prior to all sensory input notification methods as info*().

ATTENTION!!
Hear messages are handled asynchronously and therefore no preInfo is called prior to hear notifications!!

Specified by:
preInfo in interface Controller

postInfo

public void postInfo()
Description copied from interface: Controller
Called after all sensory input notification methods (info*()) were called.

ATTENTION!!
Hear messages are handled asynchronously and therefore no postInfo is called after hear notifications!!

Specified by:
postInfo in interface Controller
